page.title: 03LANDSCAPE
page.content: The conifers in the woods of Kessock and Drumsmittal on Ord Hill are being felled for export to Sweden.Below, going west along the road past N.Kessock to Charleston,you see many modern bungalows.Then come the old houses.Mr.MacRae,the retired headteacher of Drumsmittal School lives in the Mill House.The water from the old dam came down the lade to the mealmill behind the house.Now you go up steps there to the council estate. Next door lives Mr.Donald Gillies,the sheep contractor.For nearly a century his family have rented Black Isle grazing to winter lambs from the north and west of Scotland.Now farmers begin to winter their own lambs with bought feed.Twenty years ago Mr.Gillies drove a flock of sheep over the ferry and through Inverness to the mart for the last time.
